title: What is the equation of the ellipse whose length of the major axis is 26 and foci (-5,0) and (5,0)? - Quora

response.answer_text: The standard equation of an ellipse is x/asq. + y/bsq =1 where 2a and 2b are respectively major and minor axes. Also if( +or- c ,0 ) are focii c = rt( a sq.- bsq.) In the given problem c=5 ; a=26/2=13; bsq =[asq -c sq] =169 - 25 =144 ;b=12 eq.of ellipse is x/169 + y/144 =1

The general equation of an ellipse is given by [(x-xo)/a]^2 + [(y - yo)/b]^2 = 1 where (xo , yo) is the center of elipse and a and b are the axes of the ellipse along x- and y- directions. Substituting the given numeric values you get the equation as (x/13)^2 + (y/12)^2 = 1
